questions.questionsTitle: Read the paragraph and answer the following questions.

subQuestion.question: Why is my skin white and thick and why is there a thick layer of fat underneath?
subQuestion.ans:
Having black and white skin is a type of adaptation known as camouflaging.
It is called counter-shading and makes it harder for both the predators and the prey to see penguins from all sorts of angles.
The white chest of penguin protects them in the water by camouflaging them from being seen from below against the lighter sky coming through the waters surface.
Their black backs help them blend in with the darker, deeper ocean waters below them, thus protecting them from their predators.
They have thick layer of fat because it keeps them warm under such extreme cold conditions.

subQuestion.question: Why do we live in flocks sticking close to each other?
subQuestion.ans:
We know that penguins live in the coldest regions of earth and in order to find warmth and solace they remain in flocks with each other.
In order to escape the extreme cold conditions, they nestle together to keep each other warm.

subQuestion.question: Which geographical region do I inhabit? Why?
subQuestion.ans:
Penguins are found in regions of Antarctica, South America, Africa and Australia.
Many species can also be found in New Zealand and the sub-Antarctic islands.

subQuestion.question: Which adaptations should you have to enable you to live permanently in the polar region? Why?
subQuestion.ans: The following adaptations are required to survive in polar regions:black and white skin with a thick layer of fat beneath itskin should be covered with featherssmall body with small wingspresence of strong muscles in chest and wings

questions.questionsTitle: What is the inter-relationship between adaptations of organisms and their surroundings?

subQuestion.question: What is the inter-relationship between adaptations of organisms and their surroundings?
subQuestion.ans:
Cactus has thick cuticle on their leaf surface and their stomata are arranged in deep pits to minimise water loss by transpiration.
They have special photosynthetic pathway, CAM in which stomata remains closed during day time.
Their leaves are reduced to spines to minimise water loss, and photosynthetic functions are performed by flattened stems.

questions.questionsTitle: A force of 1000 N was applied to stop a car that was moving with a constant velocity. The car stopped after moving through 10 m. How much is the work done?

subQuestion.ans: Force (F) = 1000 Ndisplacement (s) = 10mwork done (W) =?Work done by the force to stop the car = F × S= 1000 × 10= 10000J

Social media such as Newspapers, TV, radio, etc.

questions.questionsTitle: Discuss and write:

subQuestion.question: Various eclipses and the conditions during the period.
subQuestion.ans:
During its revolution, when the moon comes between the sun and the earth, a shadow of the moon is cast on the earth and the sun cannot be seen from the part in the shadow.
This is called a solar eclipse.
A solar eclipse is seen only on a new moon day.
The solar eclipse may be either partial or total.
Sometimes the solar disc is completely covered by the moon.
This is the total solar eclipse.
When the solar disc is not covered fully by the moon, we have a partial solar eclipse.
During a solar eclipse, ultra-violet rays which are harmful to us reach the earth.
A solar eclipse should never be watched with the naked eye.
A special type of goggles should be used for this purpose.

subQuestion.ans: Cuscuta: Plant ParasiteExistence on the plant:Cuscutais an obligate parasite.It cannot produce its own food, so it grows by twining around the trunk of the host plant.It sucks the sap from the plant's veins.Effects on the plant:The plant becomes weak and its growth is stunted.Sometimes the plant dries up completely and dies.Use of Cuscuta by other organisms:Some insects and fungi use cuscutaas food.For example, certain types of insects live on cuscuta, which consume it.

subQuestion.question: The telephone wires which sag in summer become straight in winter.
subQuestion.ans:
Telephone wires are made of copper metal.

questions.questionsTitle: Give a scientific reason.

subQuestion.question: In winter, why does an iron pillar feel colder than a wooden pole?
subQuestion.ans: In winter, an iron pillar feels colder than a wooden pole because iron is a good conductor of heat, while wood is a poor conductor.When we touch the iron pillar, it quickly absorbs heat from our skin and transfers it away, making it feel colder.

subQuestion.question: How are the components of mixtures separated by simple methods?

should launch some programs and debates discussing the myths existing related to eclipses.

questions.questionsTitle: Discuss and write:

subQuestion.question: Various eclipses and the conditions during the period.
subQuestion.ans:
During its revolution, when the moon comes between the sun and the earth, a shadow of the moon is cast on the earth and the sun cannot be seen from the part in the shadow.
This is called a solar eclipse.
A solar eclipse is seen only on a new moon day.
The solar eclipse may be either partial or total.
Sometimes the solar disc is completely covered by the moon.
This is the total solar eclipse.
When the solar disc is not covered fully by the moon, we have a partial solar eclipse.
During a solar eclipse, ultra-violet rays which are harmful to us reach the earth.
A solar eclipse should never be watched with the naked eye.
A special type of goggles should be used for this purpose.

subAns.Column 2: It is that source of light that forms the umbra as well as the penumbra region on the screen of the shadowed object.

subAns.Column 1: e.g., a pinhole through which sunlight is entering is a point source of light.
subAns.Column 2: e.g., the sun is an extended source of light.

subAns.Column 1: It is the part of the shadow where all of the light from the source is blocked by the shadowing object.
subAns.Column 2: It is the region around the umbra where the light from the source is partially blocked by the shadowing object.

subAns.Column 1: The umbra is obtained from a point source as well as an extended source of light.

questions.questionsTitle: What is the difference between mass and weight?

subQuestion.question: What is the difference between mass and weight?
subQuestion.ans: MassWeight1.Mass is the amount of matter contained in a body.Weight is the force exerted on a body due to the gravitational pull of another body, such as Earth, the sun and the moon.2.Mass is an intrinsic property of a body.Weight is an extrinsic property of a body.3.The mass of a body remains the same everywhere in the universe.The weight of a body depends on the local acceleration due to gravity where it is placed.4.The mass of a body cannot be zero.The weight of a body can be zero.5.The SI unit of mass is kilogram (kg).Since weight is a force, its SI unit is newton (N).6.The mass of a body can be measured using a beam balance and a pan balance.The weight of a body can be measured using a spring balance and a weighing machine.

subAns.Column 2: The mass of a body cannot be zero.

questions.questionsTitle: Read the paragraph and answer the following questions.

subQuestion.question: Why is my skin white and thick and why is there a thick layer of fat underneath?
subQuestion.ans:
Having black and white skin is a type of adaptation known as camouflaging.
It is called counter-shading and makes it harder for both the predators and the prey to see penguins from all sorts of angles.
The white chest of penguin protects them in the water by camouflaging them from being seen from below against the lighter sky coming through the waters surface.
Their black backs help them blend in with the darker, deeper ocean waters below them, thus protecting them from their predators.
They have thick layer of fat because it keeps them warm under such extreme cold conditions.

subQuestion.question: Why do we live in flocks sticking close to each other?
subQuestion.ans:
We know that penguins live in the coldest regions of earth and in order to find warmth and solace they remain in flocks with each other.
In order to escape the extreme cold conditions, they nestle together to keep each other warm.

subQuestion.question: Which geographical region do I inhabit? Why?

subQuestion.ans: The following adaptations are required to survive in polar regions:black and white skin with a thick layer of fat beneath itskin should be covered with featherssmall body with small wingspresence of strong muscles in chest and wings

questions.questionsTitle: Give a scientific reason.

subQuestion.question: We can hear the movement of a mosquito's wings but we cannot hear the movement of our hands.
subQuestion.ans: The frequency of the sound produced by the movement of a mosquito's wings lies within the human audible range (20 Hz to 20,000 Hz), whereas the sound produced by the movement of our hands has a frequency below 20 Hz, which is inaudible to humans.
